lines.text: Hasta la vista, baby.

No, no, no, no. You gotta listen to the way people talk. You don't say "affirmative," or some shit like that. You say "no problemo." And if someone comes on to you with an attitude you say "eat me." And if you want to shine them on it's "hasta la vista, baby."
Hasta la vista, baby.
Yeah but later, dickwad. And if someone gets upset you say, "chill out"! Or you can do combinations.
Chill out, dickwad.
Great! See, you're getting it!
No problemo.
I need your clothes, your boots and your motorcycle.
You forgot to say please...
Come with me if you want to live!
[the Terminator has promised not to kill anybody, but to get into the hospital he shoots the guard in the legs]
He'll live.
Why do you cry?
You mean people?
Yes.
I don't know. We just cry. You know, when it hurts.
Pain causes it?
No, it's when there's nothing wrong with you, but you hurt anyway. You get it?
No.
Todd and Janelle are dicks, but I've gotta warn them. You got a quarter?
[the Terminator smashes into the coin bin and hands John a quarter]

[answers the phone]
Hello?
Hey, Janelle, it's me.
John? John, it's getting late, I want to have dinner with you, I'm making beef stew.

[holds the phone]
Something's wrong, she's never this nice.
John, I'm getting worried about you. Where are you?

[hearing Max barking outside]
What the hell is that goddamn dog barking at?
[shouting to Max]
Hey, shut up you worthless piece of shit!

[to himself]
I can hear the dog barking. Maybe it's already over there.
We should tell John to get rid of that fucking mutt.

[uses her arm to kill Todd]
John, where are you?

[takes the phone from John and impersonates his voice to talk]
I'm here, Janelle. I'm fine.
John, it's late, where are you?

[to John; normal voice]
What's the dog's name?
Max.

[impersonating John's voice]
Hey Janelle, what's wrong with Wolfie? I can hear him barking. Is he all right?
Wolfie's fine, honey. Wolfie's just fine. Where are you?

[hangs up the phone]
Your foster parents are dead. Let's go.
The future's not set. There's no fate but what we make for ourselves.
I'll take care of the police.
Hey, wait! You swore!

[smiles]
Trust me.

[voiceover]
Watching John with the machine, it was suddenly so clear. The terminator, would never stop. It would never leave him, and it would never hurt him, never shout at him, or get drunk and hit him, or say it was too busy to spend time with him. It would always be there. And it would die, to protect him. Of all the would-be fathers who came and went over the years, this thing, this machine, was the only one who measured up. In an insane world, it was the sanest choice.
We've got company!... Police!
How many?
Uh... all of 'em, I think.
You broke my arm!
There are 215 bones in the human body. That's one.
[the T-1000 has fallen into a vat of molten steel]
Is it dead?
Terminated.
I know now why you cry
[wipes a tear from John's face]
but it's something that I can never do
We're not gonna make it, are we? People, I mean.
It's in your nature to destroy yourselves.
Yeah. Major drag, huh?
[last lines]

[narrating]
The unknown future rolls toward us. I face it, for the first time, with a sense of hope. Because if a machine, a Terminator, can learn the value of human life, maybe we can too.
You just can't go around killing people.
Why?
What do you mean why? 'Cause you can't.
Why?
Because you just can't, okay? Trust me on this.
Are you ever afraid?
No.
Not even of dying?
No.
You don't feel any emotion about it one way or another?
No. I have to stay functional until my mission is complete. Then it doesn't matter.
Yeah. I have to stay functional too. I'm "too important".
We need to get my mother.
Negative. The T-1000's highest probability for success now will be to copy Sarah Connor and to wait for you to make contact with her.
Great, but what happens to her?
Typically, the subject being copied is terminated.
Shit! Why didn't you tell me? We gotta go right now!
Negative. She's not a mission priority.
Fuck you! She's a priority to me!
I'm sure it feels very real to you.
On August 29th, 1997, it's gonna feel pretty fucking real to you too. Anybody not wearing 2 million sunblock is gonna have a real bad day. Get it?

[as he hacks an ATM]
Please insert your stolen card now.
[first lines]

to destroy the leader of the human resistance, John Connor, my son. The first Terminator was programmed to strike at me in the year 1984, before John was born. It failed. The second was set to strike at John himself when he was still a child. As before, the resistance was able to send a lone warrior, a protector for John. It was just a question of which one of them would reach him first.
Say... That's a nice bike...
Get out.
Your foster parents are kinda dicks, huh?
14 a.m. Eastern time, August 29th. In a panic, they try to pull the plug.
Skynet fights back.
Yes. It launches its missiles against the targets in Russia.
Why attack Russia? Aren't they our friends now?
Because Skynet knows that the Russian counterattack will eliminate its enemies over here.
Can you learn stuff you haven't been programmed with so you could be... you know, more human? And not such a dork all the time?
My CPU is a neural-net processor; a learning computer. But Skynet presets the switch to read-only when we're sent out alone.
Doesn't want you doing too much thinking, huh?
No.
Where are we going?
We have to get out of the city immediately and avoid the authorities.
Listen, I need to stop my my house. I want to pick up some stuff before we leave.
Negative. The T-1000 will definitely try to reacquire you there.
Are you sure?
I would.

[John starts to cry]
What's wrong with your eyes?
Did you call *moi* a dipshit?
[One-armed and battered after confronting the T-1000]
I need a vacation.
Jesus, you were gonna kill that guy.
Of course; I'm a Terminator.
You know what you're doing?
I have detailed files on human anatomy.
I'll bet. Makes you a more efficient killer, right?
Correct.
[Dyson's personal code fails to access the computer room]

[raises a grenade launcher]
Let me try mine.
You came here to stop me?
Yeah, I did.
[Lewis, the Guard buys a cup of coffee, just before he is introduced to the T-1000]
Hey Gwen, you want some coffee?
No thanks. How 'bout a beer?
Yeah, right.
[examines his cup]
Hey, I got a full house!
That's good Lewis.
Must be my lucky day...
[the T-1000 impales his head]
We got Skynet by the balls now, don't we?
You're the one livin' in a fuckin' dream, Silberman! 'Cause I know when it happens! It happens!
I swear I will not kill anyone.
Skynet, Judgment Day, the history of things to come. It's not everyday you find out that you're responsible for three billion deaths. He took it pretty well.

[after the Terminator completes his story]
I feel like I'm gonna throw up. You're judging me on things that I haven't even done yet. How are we supposed to know.

Yeah, right. How are you supposed to know? Fucking men like you built the hydrogen bomb. Men like you thought it up. You thikn you're so creative. You don't know what it's like to really create something; to create a life; to feel it growing inside you. All you know how to create is death and destruction...
Mom! We need to be a little more constructive here, okay? We still have to stop this from happening, don't we?
[the Terminator hoists a huge gun and lopsidedly smiles]
It's definitely you.
Stay here. I'll be back.
Does it hurt when you get shot?
I sense injuries. The data could be called "pain."
he's a Terminator like you, right?
Not like me. A T-1000, advanced prototype.
You mean more advanced than you are?
Yes. A mimetic polyalloy.
What the hell does that mean?
Liquid metal.
You're not here to kill me. I figured out that for myself. So what's the deal?
My mission is to protect you.
Yeah? Who sent you?
You did. Thirty-five years from now, you reprogrammed me to be your protector here, in this time.
This is deep...
It won't work, Sarah. You're no killer. I don't believe you'd do it.
You're already dead, Silberman. Everybody dies. You know I believe it, so don't fuck with me!
Are you the legal guardian of John Connor?
That's right, Officer. What's he done now?
Could I speak with him please?
You could if he were here. He just took off on his bike. So, he could be anywhere.
Do you have a photograph of John?
Yeah, sure, hold on.
Could you tell me what this is about?
Just need to ask him a few questions.
[Janelle gives the photo to T-1000]
He's a good looking boy. Do you mind if I keep this picture?
No, go on. There was a guy here this morning looking for him, too.
Yeah, a big guy on a bike. Does that got something to do with this?
No, I wouldn't worry about him. Thanks for your cooperation.

[the Terminator rips open the steering column of a car to hotwire it, John interrupts, jingling a set of keys before him]
Are we learning yet?
Good Morning, Sarah.
Good Morning, Dr. Silberman. How's the knee?
Fine, Sarah.

[turns to the team of doctors with him]
She... uh, stabbed me in the knee cap with my pen a few weeks ago.
Wait a minute here. You're telling me that this thing can imitate anything it touches?
Anything it samples by physical contact.
Get real, like it could disguise itself as a pack of cigarettes?
No, only an object of equal size.
Then why doesn't it become a bomb or a machine gun or something to get me?
The T-1000 can't form complex machines. Guns and explosives have chemicals in them. Moving parts. It doesn't work that way, but it can form solid metal shapes.
Like what?
Knives and stabbing weapons.
Just let the boy go.
Shut up! Shut up, shut up, SHUT UP! It's all your fault! Motherfucker, it's all your fault!
What?

[to the Terminator]
So what's your story?
You, in the window! Drop your weapon and put your hands on your head!

[the Terminator starts firing minigun]
Shit! That's a damn minigun!
Hi. Um, Carl. These are friends from out of town, I'm just gonna take them upstairs and show them around.
Now, c'mon Mr. Dyson, you know the rules if you want to bring visitors into the lab. I need written authorization...

[the Terminator and Sarah draw their guns]
I insist.

[Gibbons is trying to push the alarm button]
Don't even think about it.

[after swiping his card on a control panel, nothing happens]
My card should access this thing.
[swipes his card several times more, nothing happens, then he tries to open it up with his hand]
What happened?
Dammit.
[checks the map screen and finds out what is going on]
The silent alarm is tripped. All of the codes are neutralized in the entire building, nothing will open anywhere now. We have to abort.

[gets in front of Dyson]
No. We'll go all the way.
Gibbons?
[seeing the front deak empty and turning towards the bathroom]
Gibbons, c'mon man, you can't leave the desk like that!
[opens the outer bathroom door]
Gibbons!
[opens the inner bathroom door, sees Gibbons tied to a urinal base and gagged]
Oh, shit!

[to the Terminator]
This severe routine is getting old. You're acting like such a geek.

[showing a series of photographs taken with the Terminator]
These were taken by a video surveillance camera, at the Westtown police station, in 1984. He killed 17 police officers that night. Men with families, children.
These were taken at a mall in Receda...
[shows two new photographs of the Terminator]
Today.

Ms. Connor, we know you know who this guy is. Look, I just sat here and told you that your son is missing, that the foster parents have been murdered. We know this guy's involved. Doesn't that mean anything to you? Don't you care?
[no response from Sarah as Weatherby waves a hand in front of her eyes]
Sorry, guys. She grows more and more disconnected from reality as time goes on.

[they're travelling in an ancient truck with the T-1000 hot on their heels]
Step on it!

[the truck is only going about 65]
This is the vehicle's top speed.
I could get out and run faster than this!
[from Extended Special Edition ending]

[speaks into her recorder]
August 29, 1997, came and went. Nothing much happened. Michael Jackson turned 40. There was no Judgment Day. People went to work as they always do. Laughed, complained, watched TV, made love. I wanted to run to through the street yelling to grab them all and say, "Every day from this day on is a gift. Use it well." Instead, I got drunk. That was 30 years ago. But the dark future which never came still exists for me. And it always will, like the traces of a dream. John fights the way differently than it was foretold. Here, on the battlefield of the Senate his weapons are common sense and hope.

[runs up to Sarah]
Tie me, Grandma. Tie me!
How's that?
Thank you, Grandma.
The luxury of hope was given to me by the Terminator. Because if a machine can learn the value of human life, maybe we can too.
[John Connor wants to get some things from home]
Negative. The T-1000 will definitely try to reacquire you there.
You sure?
I would.
Easy money.
Now don't take this the wrong way, but you're a Terminator, right?
Yes. Cyberdyne Systems, Model 101.
My CPU is a neural-net processor; a learning computer. The more contact I have with humans, the more I learn.

[armed with a hypodermic syringe inudated with drain cleaner]
I'll pump him full of this shit; I swear!

[the T-1000 pursues John, Sarah, and the Terminator in a police helicopter]
Chopper's coming in!
It's him.

[the Terminator starts the motorcycle, Lloyd comes out the diner's door with a sawed-off 10-Gauge Winchester Lever-Action Shotgun]
I can't let you take the man's wheels, son. Now get off before I put you down.

[the Terminator gets off the motorcycle and walks towards Lloyd]
That's it, Goddammit.
Come with me if you want to live.

[to Sarah and John while he deals with an LA SWAT team]
Stay here. I'll be back.
